release: Am I Using Content Or Is Content Using Me?
title_full:

label: Different Circles
description:
Raime mutate Eski grime, post-punk, R&B, dembow rhythms and a bank of YouTube ‘Fail’ samples on this killer twelve for Different Circles, big if yr into Jon E Cash, Rapid, Rian Treanor, Gabor Lazor, Low Jack, Photek's 'Ni-Ten-Ichi-Ryu'...

Raime reach a pivotal moment in their catalogue with the sidewinders of Am I Using Content Or Is Content Using Me?, their... more

label: Youth
description:
Killer debut release from FUMU, coughing up 18 sawn-off tracks of fucked hip hop, warehouse and techno on Andrew Lyster’s Youth label. Definitely mark this gadge in your one-to-watch list. 

Hailing from downwind of heavy North East industry, but currently sequestered in Manchester, FUMU is a member of the Return to Zero crew and a known... more

title_full:
Rian Treanor

              —
              RAVEDIT
            
              (The Death Of Rave)
label: The Death Of Rave
description:
Rian Treanor returns with a whitelabel 12” featuring hyper spins on ’80s synth-pop, Lollywood soundtracks and ’90s Eurodance, rendered in his inimitable, disruptive style...

Across four radical edits, familiar and obscure ohrwurms are dissected and flipped in thrilling new ways, rendering razor sharp and playfully nutty updates of Eurodance... more

label: PAN
description: PAN’s butterfly net captures IRISIRI, the 3rd solo album by Alex Drewchin a.k.a. Eartheater, who provides the label’s first release of 2018, and one of its most sublime since Yves Tumor’s Serpent Music or the Mono No Aware set. Alexa’s first two Eartheater albums were released at either end of 2015 to critical acclaim - Metalepsis was Fact Mag’s album of the... more

title_full:
Elysia Crampton

              —
              Elysia Crampton
            
              (Break World Records)
label: Break World Records
description:
Elysia Crampton’s eponymous opus - their 4th official album - is a peerless study in sonic ontology, exerting a psychedelic spin on notions of roots & future in a studiously conscious and intricately woven yet immediate manner that’s core to Elysia’s oeuvre. We’re really feeling this one; reckon you might, too

“Dedicated to Ofelia aka Carlos Espinosa, china* travesti... more

label: Hyperdub
description: On Lee Gamble’s stunning first major work since Koch [2014], the rave dreamer reawakens to decode and interpret his hallucinations for Hyperdub, coming to terms with the idea of Mnestic Pressure - a confluence of individual and collective pressures on contemporary memory - in an astonishly febrile, vivid collision and projection of jungle and ambient... more

title_full:
Kode9 & Burial

              —
              FABRICLIVE 100: Kode9 & Burial
            
              (Fabric Records / Fabric Worldwide)
label: Fabric Records / Fabric Worldwide
description:
Who better to inter Fabric’s long-running series than the demon DJ Kode 9 and his accomplice, Burial? Yeh, nobody’s shouting Craig Richards, so this will have to do.

So it’s basically NOT a new Burial album, or even a Kode 9 & Burial album, but it is one of the strongest mixes in Fabric’s near 20 year history, cataloguing and webbing 37 tracks from the... more

artist: Mika Vainio + Ryoji Ikeda + Alva Noto
title_full:
Mika Vainio + Ryoji Ikeda + Alva Noto

              —
              Live 2002
            
              (NOTON)
label: NOTON
description:
Carsten Nicolai’s Noton present a masterclass in minimalist electronic discipline with Mika Vainio, Ryoji Ikeda + Alva Noto’s powerfully future-proofed Live 2002 performance, recorded at Newcastle’s Baltic arts centre.

The only known recording of the trio, as far as we’re aware, Live 2002 documents three visionary artists in seamless, indivisible collaboration... more

label: ZamZam Sounds
description:
Unexpectedly terrific little 7” of dubbed-out rufige from Melbourne, Australia’s Pugilist

The A-side is the one for us - a wicked, scuzzy brukbeat licked up with soundsystem chat in a way recalling classic 2562 and Shackleton, but with a fizzing parry that Pugilist can safely call his own. B-side offers a fine contrast with ‘Hemisphere’, where he drifts thru... more

label: Kranky
description: The first Grouper album in 4 years finds Liz Harris stripped of FX, pairing her vocals with skeletal piano gestures in beautifully pregnant space. For anyone familiar with the miasmic fuzz of Grouper’s previous releases, the relative clarity is quietly shocking in effect, revealing her songs and sound at their most vulnerable, and, in the process, locating a... more

label: Young Echo
description: The overdue and overproof sophomore Young Echo album is finally upon us, dispensing an epic 24 tracks of subby, red-eyed and distinctively Bristolian vibes set to dank-out smoky dwellings everywhere. Arriving five years after Nexus, their eponymous second album features cuts from each of the 11-strong mob, framing a fractious mosaic of style and... more

label: PAN
description: Surely the most innovative dancefloor album you'll hear in 2017; complete joyful abandonment that's both utilitarian and absolutely daring in form. You dont need a PHD to get behind this one, though having one in quantum mechanics might help you unravel the seemingly endless energy levels woven into its fabric - having taken no less than 13 years to... more

label: Modern Love
description:
Demdike land a new 9-track doublepack for Modern Love; a delirious odyssey from UKG to angular and freakish rhythmic jackers, highly recommended if yr into their Testpressing series or anything from Errorsmith to Príncipe, Dem 2, Jon E Cash, Wiley to Joy Division, DJ Scud, Equiknoxx, Anthony ‘Shake’ Shakir or Bernard Parmegiani...

Since the release of their... more

label: Domino Recording Co
description:
Tirzah pursues the slowest-burning soul feels on Devotion, the London-based singer-songwriter’s humbly singular début album, produced by Mica Levi and providing us with total life affirming summer listening - most probably the record we've listened to most this year so far, and one that lingers on and on...

Since her first solo 12”s  and thru frequent... more

release:
If You're Into It, I'm Out Of It 
            
              (Cross Fade Enter Tainment [CFET])
title_full:
Christoph De Babalon

              —
              If You're Into It, I'm Out Of It (2018 Special Edition)
            
              (Cross Fade Enter Tainment [CFET])
label: 2018 Special Edition
description: Surely one of the most ear-catching and unique reissues of the year, Christoph De Babalon’s 'If You’re Into It, I’m Out Of It' is a late ‘90s neo-noir ambient and D&B masterpiece - imagine if The Caretaker made fierce, unrelenting Jungle and you almost get an idea of what’s inside - reissued to mark the occasion of its 21st anniversary to plaudits from a new... more

label: Other Other Recordings
description:
Sibling duo Elisabetta and Emanuele Porcinai conjure an absorbingly glum sort of electro-acoustic, ambient songcraft on ‘Threads’, their first record as Aperture. Traces of Felicia Atkinson’s ephemeral narrations, the shoegazing labour of Grouper, and the decayed wist of Cotton Goods all spring to mind inside.

“Together they produce elegantly brooding songs and... more

release: Return To Zero: FUMU - NTS Show
title_full: Return To Zero: FUMU - NTS Show

label: Sony
description:
Chances are anything you’ll listen to after sitting through this half hour masterpiece will sound a bit lifeless - El Mal Querer is the most vibrant, layered and forward facing album of the year.

Rosalía Vila Tobella is already something of a sensation in her native Spain, but this new album looks certain to propel her into the stratosphere with its immediately accessible... more
